bbc.title: US and Iran talks to begin as fears of direct conflict continue
bbc.description: The US has built up its military presence in the Middle East in response to Iran's violent crackdown on protests.

bbc.title: We had sex in a Chinese hotel, then found we had been broadcast to thousands
bbc.description: A couple who stayed in Shenzhen discovered their intimate moments were filmed as spy-cam porn.

bbc.title: Russia and Ukraine exchange prisoners as peace talks end without breakthrough
bbc.description: The swap - the first since October - sees 157 Ukrainians and 160 Russians returned home.

bbc.title: Starmer apologises to Epstein victims for believing Mandelson's 'lies'
bbc.description: The PM says the depth of the pair's relationship was not known when he was appointed US ambassador.

bbc.title: Suspect identified in disappearance of four-year-old in Australian outback
bbc.description: Gus Lamont was last seen playing outside his home on a remote sheep station on 27 September.

bbc.title: Lebanon says Israel sprayed southern villages with concentrated herbicide
bbc.description: Israel declines to comment on the allegation its planes sprayed glyphosate over an area with extensive farmland.

bbc.title: Japanese city cancels cherry blossom festival over badly behaved tourists
bbc.description: "Overtourism" during Japan's iconic blossom season makes life for locals in Fujiyoshida town unmanageable, authorities say.

bbc.title: Norway investigates former PM Jagland over alleged Epstein links

wsj.title: Palestinians Stream Back to Northern Gaza on Foot
wsj.description: Israel allowed displaced Gazans to begin crossing a military zone that bisects the enclave after a deadlock over hostage releases was broken.

wsj.title: Leading China Property Developer Reports Huge loss, in Sign of Widening Real-Estate Woes
wsj.description: Troubles at Vanke raise questions about the continued spread of the property crisis and whether the Chinese state will step in.

wsj.title: Freed Israeli Hostages Still Had Shrapnel in Their Bodies From Oct. 7 Attack
wsj.description: Some of the women were held alone for extended periods and spent eight months in tunnels, an Israeli medical official said.

wsj.title: Suspected Sabotage of Deep-Sea Cable Triggers First NATO-Led Response
wsj.description: The alliance mounted its first coordinated response to a suspected sabotage campaign against critical infrastructure after another cable was severed in the Baltic Sea.

wsj.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Safe-Haven City
wsj.description: Residents of Goma reported gunfire and shelling after rebels overran Congolese troops. U.N. officials estimated that more than one million displaced people were now inside the city.

wsj.title: Cocaine-Funded Gangs Shake Colombia Years After Peace Pact
wsj.description: Attacks by powerful militias against civilians reflect the state’s inaction eight years after a peace accord removed a powerful rebel group from the field.

wsj.title: Italy Supports Saudi Arabia Joining Fighter-Jet Program, PM Meloni Says
wsj.description: The U.K., Italy and Japan have already partnered on the Global Combat Air Programme, which aims to put a new stealth fighter with supersonic capability in the skies by 2035.

wsj.title: Shippers Wary of Red Sea Routes Despite Houthi Pledge to End Targeting
wsj.description: The world’s top three container operators said they fear instability in Gaza and broader regional tensions mean continued danger.

wsj.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
wsj.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

wsj.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
wsj.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

wsj.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
wsj.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

wsj.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
wsj.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

wsj.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
wsj.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

wsj.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
wsj.description: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

wsj.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
wsj.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

wsj.title: Building-Products Distributor QXO Launches Hostile Bid for Beacon
wsj.description: QXO is taking its offer directly to shareholders after being rebuffed on several occasions.

bloomberg.title: Stock Selloff Extends as Tech, Silver Rout Worsens: Markets Wrap
bloomberg.description: Global stocks extended their tumble into Asian trading on Friday after heavy losses in US tech stocks and cryptocurrencies sapped risk appetite. Silver slid again, while Treasuries stabilized.

bloomberg.title: Little-Known Hedge Fund Trader Makes Billions at Brevan Howard
bloomberg.description: Minal Bathwal hasn’t had a losing year since he started managing money in 2008.

bloomberg.title: South Korean Stocks Tumble as Global Tech Selloff Accelerates
bloomberg.description: South Korean equities slumped as a global selloff in risk assets swept up some of the country’s tech heavyweights, exposing vulnerability in the world’s best-performing market.

bloomberg.title: Moody’s Warning Puts Indonesia’s Policy Choices Under Scrutiny
bloomberg.description: Moody’s Ratings lowered Indonesia’s credit outlook to negative, adding to growing warnings about policy uncertainty and weakening governance under President Prabowo Subianto’s administration.

bloomberg.title: Silver Extends Plunge, Wiping Out Gains in Very Volatile Market
bloomberg.description: Silver fell, after plunging 20% on Thursday, as a lack of liquidity led to wild price swings in a market struggling to find a floor.

bloomberg.title: Bitcoin Drops Below $61,000, Wiping Out Gain Since Trump’s Win
bloomberg.description: Bitcoin tumbled below $61,000, as the unwinding of leveraged bets and broader market turbulence deepened a selloff that has wiped out all of the gains since President Donald Trump’s election set off a

bloomberg.title: Jennifer Garner’s Once Upon a Farm Valued at $724 Million in IPO

bloomberg.title: Oil Extends Decline With Focus on US-Iran Nuclear Negotiations
bloomberg.description: Oil extended its biggest one-day drop in three weeks, with planned talks between Iran and the US later on Friday easing the immediate risk of military conflict and supply disruptions.

bloomberg.title: Trump Touts Drug Cost Savings as He Launches TrumpRx Website
bloomberg.description: President Donald Trump launched a new website to help Americans directly buy select medicines at a discount, seeking to counter cost-of-living concerns that pose a threat to his party in November’s co

bloomberg.title: Australia’s Falling China Trade Surplus Rings Economic Alarm
bloomberg.description: Australia’s trade surplus shrank to the lowest since 2018, underscoring how China’s soaring exports and weak imports are reshaping merchandise flows and potentially dragging down major trade partners.

bloomberg.title: Soaring Food Bills Pose Risk to Takaichi’s Election Prospects
bloomberg.description: A key issue on the minds of voters heading into Japan’s national election on Sunday will be their stomachs — that is, the rising cost of filling them.

bloomberg.title: Trump Endorses Japan’s Takaichi Ahead of Sunday Election
bloomberg.description: Donald Trump endorsed Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi ahead of a lower house election set for Sunday that polls suggest will hand Takaichi a resounding victory.

bloomberg.title: What to Expect From US, Iran Talks Friday in Oman?
bloomberg.description: Bloomberg's Becca Wasser & Wayne Sanders state they are not optimistic when discussing what they expect from the US and Iran when both countries speak Friday in Oman. They suggest it seems both sides

bloomberg.title: UK Hosts ‘Dragons’ Den’ Events to Draw Defense Investment
bloomberg.description: The UK is seeking to attract private capital to boost British defense startups with a series of “Dragons’ Den”-style events amid worries about how quickly the government will follow through on its own

bloomberg.title: Rep. Meeks on Bitcoin, Bessent, DHS
bloomberg.description: Representative Gregory Meeks (D) NY provides insights on the current state of the cryptocurrency market and discusses the concerns raised by other Democratic lawmakers in regards to crypto regulation.

aljazeera.title: Venezuela’s National Assembly approves amnesty bill in first of two votes
aljazeera.description: The bill would provide clemency for opposition members and protesters who have been charged with crimes under Maduro.

aljazeera.title: T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka urge Pakistan to reconsider India boycott

aljazeera.title: Cuba to introduce plan to address fuel shortage amid US blockade
aljazeera.description: The shortage has led to blackouts across the Caribbean nation.

aljazeera.description: The US president has praised the Hungarian leader for his hardline approach to immigration and nationalist policies.

aljazeera.description: Global Sumud Flotilla to carry up to 1,000 activists in largest-ever 'coordinated humanitarian intervention' for Gaza.

washpost.title: U.S., Russia to resume high-level military talks
washpost.description: A U.S. official called the deal a by-product of ongoing efforts to end the Ukraine war. It came as a key nuclear treaty between Washington and Moscow expired.

washpost.title: The treaty limiting U.S. and Russian nuclear arms expired. What to know.
washpost.description: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he hoped to replace New START with a modernized treaty that could “last long into the future.”

washpost.title: As West goes after Russia’s oil fleet, Moscow fears for its war funding

washpost.description: The president noted plans to visit China in April, as Beijing sends a warning to White House over Taiwan arms sales.

washpost.title: Andrew, ex-prince linked to Epstein, moves out of royal residence

washpost.description: International criminal syndicates have been using Fiji as a transshipment point for drugs originating in Southeast Asia and Latin America.

washpost.description: Some advocates say the Winter Games are driving up property prices and exacerbating income inequality.
